benchmark_details.name: NATURAL INSTRUCTIONS
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce NATURAL INSTRUCTIONS, a dataset of 61 distinct tasks, their human-authored instructions, and 193k task instances (input-output pairs). The instructions are obtained from crowdsourcing instructions used to create existing NLP datasets and mapped to a unified schema.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To build models that generalize to new tasks by encoding and understanding crowdsourcing instructions.

data.source: Crowdsourced instructions from existing NLP datasets
data.annotation: Collected through crowdsourcing platforms with a unified schema.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the generated outputs compared to the expected outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROUGE-L scores indicate better performance of models in generating accurate task outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: BART achieves higher performance when using full instructions compared to without instructions.
methodology.validation: Results were validated against human-annotated performance.
